website_summaries.verdict: For sorting change into coin wrappers, you won't find a simpler or more affordable option.
pros: These color-coded tubes are easy to use and accurately fill coin wrappers for pennies through quarters
cons: This set does not include coin wrappers
Also makes coin sorting a more manual process than with automated coin sorters

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: These counting tubes work great. It takes all the work out of rolling coins. I had 45 years of pennies saved, more than 90 pounds. I culled them for Wheat pennies and separated them into Copper & Zink. Then the chore of wrapping them. I bought these coin counting tubes and used coin wrappers from the bank. It was a breeze! I am so amazed, I made a demonstration video on you tube. You can see it here: [...]
customer_reviews.author: JustOne

customer_reviews.title: Helpful, not perfect though
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes I’d check myself and on the penny tubes I was sometimes off by 1. Haven’t tried the nickel or dime tubes yet, but the quarter one was good. I guess maybe pennies can get more thin over time? I don’t know.... but it was still helpful. I used the free rolls from the bank and they worked fine. Sometimes as you slide it down you need to shake and vibrate the tube to work it down... or put a finger over the top and invert it’s you shake. Those people who say they can roll just as quick doing it the “old fashioned way”, I think they are exaggerating. There is no way this isn’t helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Bret C.

customer_reviews.title: I use it to count all the coins in my ...
customer_reviews.text: I use it to count all the coins in my shop. I hope the manufacturer can put labels on all the tubes to specify the quarters, dimes, etc and total amount when it's full. In that way, you don't need to memorize which color is for which coin.
customer_reviews.author: Chris C.

customer_reviews.title: Very happy.
customer_reviews.text: These are easy to use, and seem pretty accurate, except for maybe the pennies, however I believe that is because pennies in general seem to vary in thickness much more then the other coins. Nickles, dimes and quarters, I would use these and be confident in letting the tube do the counting for me. With the pennies you might get an extra penny in the roll, but who cares it is just a penny. Sometimes it is a little stubborn but I can usually get a preformed paper roll to slide into the tube after I have filled it, which makes putting the coins in paper rolls quick and easy.
customer_reviews.author: Manders

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: The slot where the extras come out or SUPPOSED to is a JOKE!! Just sliding of edge of flat surface is a JOKE TOO! Out of $200 in loose change NEVER once did the overage correct itself with the slot AND most change ended up on the floor during the process...the funnel/tube would not stay flush with flat surface.
customer_reviews.author: andie

customer_reviews.title: Useful if you have a lot of change
customer_reviews.text: I had JARS upon JARS to count of coins that I saved for the entirety of 2018 and I don’t know who I thought was going to count that change for me but I realized in December, it was me. While it took some time to figure out how to get the correct amount in the tubes, once I did, I could roll a decent number of pennies in half an hour. With all the change I had to count, I would say total time combined was like less than a week, I took many breaks/days to not deal with it because it was too much.
customer_reviews.author: cheeech

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this purchase. I looked about in office supply stores, big box stores etc. and the prices were more than I wanted to spend. These worked perfectly with the pre-rolled coin wrappers. My husband and I rolled over $600 in Quarters, dimes and nickels within 1.5 hours after this arrived in the mail. And it cost a lot less than using the coin star in the stores.
customer_reviews.author: Robin Satterwhite

customer_reviews.title: good buy for the price
customer_reviews.text: I had to sort through a 5 gallon old sparklets water bottle full of change. While the marking for the amount you would want to put in the coin rollers was a bit inconsistent, it wast that big of a deal for me to count out 2 at a time into the funnel for the right amount. I didn't give it 5 star just because it is inconsistent. I highly recommend this for people ho have a lot of change to sort through.
customer_reviews.author: NikkiTop Contributor: Sewing

customer_reviews.title: They counted perfectly
customer_reviews.text: When I was reading reviews I found some of these that seemed to have trouble with getting the right number of coins for a roll. In the end I bought the separate counters and separators because these appeared to be more accurate. Said reviews were correct--these are perfectly accurate, and we had no trouble getting the coins rolled.
customer_reviews.author: Periwinkle

customer_reviews.title: So quick and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: These color-coded coin rolling devices are wonderful. I was able to roll $1,500 in coins in under an hour, saving about $150 in Coinstar/bank rolling fees. I went to the local bank and picked up the roll tubes for free and came back a little bit later and the teller couldn’t believe how fast I rolled them. They are well made and easy to use, I would buy again if I never needed to but they seem like they will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Xperiance

customer_reviews.title: If you need to count coins and get them into paper wrappers - these are your best friend!
customer_reviews.text: At my job we count tons and tons of coins - these tubes make it so easy! - just flick flick flick goes the coins into the tubes, pinch that paper wrapper at the sides ( a technique and skill that takes time to acquire ) insert it, flip it and you got a paper wrapped roll of coins in less than 5 seconds! (I'm saying it's less than 5 seconds to get the coins from the tube into the paper wrapper - how long it takes to flick the coins into the tube depends on your counting skills!)
customer_reviews.author: Crystal O

customer_reviews.title: Save money over paying a store to count your coins.
customer_reviews.text: I was very skeptical that these would work well, but they are very simple to use, much cheaper than an automatic machine, and probably just as fast as they less expensive home machines. There may be multiple methods, but simply insert coins up to the slot, then shimmying the coin roll down the tube causes very little jamming with a bit of patience. Instructions could have been helpful, but a video or worded guide seemed to help.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Geffken

customer_reviews.title: Spot check the count when you start.
customer_reviews.text: I would spot check count your coins after measuring at least every now and then. the penny counter is over by 1 when they are newer coins. not that big of a deal since its just a penny but, My dime counting tube is two dimes heavy on the count and that adds up quick. Other than that it sure makes life so much easier when rolling coins!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mtn_Lifer

customer_reviews.title: Could hardly be easier.
customer_reviews.text: I just finished rolling up $1,710 worth of quarters, and short of having it done by a machine, or by somebody else, it could hardly have been easier. These are very well designed... from the funnel, to the slot where excess coins fall from, to the large finger-hole at the bottom which makes it easy to straighten out coin jams. They have a quality feel to them, and will obviously last for a long time. Even the box is sturdy, which is nice as these will spend most of the time in storage. It's the perfect tool for the job, and turned a potential nightmare into something that was actually pleasant to do.
customer_reviews.author: Concerned City-zen

customer_reviews.title: I saw that some reviewers were disappointed that the tubes weren't labeled
customer_reviews.text: The only problem I have with this product is, it's hard to slip the paper rolls down around the coins. but it did get easier the more I did. That said, I still got the job done in 1/4 the time (or less) and more accurately than the old way. I saw that some reviewers were disappointed that the tubes weren't labeled. They are color coded with the markings on the paper rolls. i.e. red on pennies, green on dimes, blue on nickels, and orange on quarters. Very good product for us change collectors.
customer_reviews.author: Peabody

customer_reviews.title: Takes guess work out of counting
customer_reviews.text: Bought these so I could wrap coins and not waste my money at 12 percent or so at coin star machine and cost of some of the automated machines. This was reasonably priced and so easy a young child can even help. I wondered how it would know if it counted correct and anything higher than slit in the plastic tube is excess. So easy. The hardest part which isn’t hard is putting coins in wrappers.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: LOVE! Works GREAT!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE THESE! I work for a non profit that does a coin drive campaign twice a year. Our bank recently got rid of the free coin counting machine we had been using since the coin campaigns started. I was dreading even the thought of counting and rolling ALL those coins coming in. These made it so so easy. We were able to fairly quickly sort them into piles and very quickly have them rolled perfectly in much less time than anticipated. Highly Highly Recommend! Works great every single time!
customer_reviews.author: Carli

customer_reviews.title: Works As Suggested and A Great Price
customer_reviews.text: Works just Fine For Rolling My coins, now that the Coin Dispenser Machine cannot be used at TD Bank due to a law suite by a customer who alleges they shorted him/her when using the machine. Rolling my own coins takes time and refuse to pay the Supermarket 10% of my money so I could use their Coin Machine - that is just wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia A. Seidel

customer_reviews.title: These R Great
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoyed rolling coins with these, so easy, so fast, never want to drop coins in the machines again, having fun and not paying out 12% to the machine, So Much Fun SMF
customer_reviews.author: Rob Aldo

customer_reviews.title: Could be better or maybe it is just me?
customer_reviews.text: I like it a little bit cause it works for the quarters and nickles. It does not work or fit the pennies and dimes with the pre-formed paper rollers. I wish I could get my money back because for that amount of money they should all work equally well. Just my experience with the product. If I just put the pennies and dimes in it works but I really needed a way to get them in the paper wrappers.
customer_reviews.author: SugarPlumdolls, Alabama

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: These are well made, not some cheap thin plastic so they should last me for years. I save my change tossing it in a box when I get home. Then every few months I roll the coins to take to the bank. The count is on the money...pun intended.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: These are fun and easy to use. Just make sure you have a sturdy paper coin roller. Then the coins go right in with the flip of a wrist. If you have a cheap flimsy paper coin roller then the coins fall all over the place.
customer_reviews.author: Darlene Williams

customer_reviews.title: These make coin rolling a lot easier!
customer_reviews.text: These make coin rolling a lot easier. They're not too hard to store because the nickel tube fits inside the quarter tube, the dime inside the penny tube. I find it easiest to shake them a bit as I slide the coin roll paper into the tube.
customer_reviews.author: the puzzler

customer_reviews.title: Saved money by not having to use a coinstar!!
customer_reviews.text: These money counting funnels really work. I had over $300 in change that I had to count out because I did not want to use a coinstar. When I went to the bank to deposit my coins it was the correct amount in each coin roll.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa B.

customer_reviews.title: I also had some of the round 'pre-formed' rolls like they sell at Target (and are available on Amazon) ...
customer_reviews.text: Helped me roll $500 worth of change quickly and efficiently. Very satified with this purchase. Some helpful info: if youre using the flat paper rolls, it does takes a little bit of practice and finessing in order to get the coins (first roll took me a few minutes of fiddling to figure out, but after I got it down, I rolled 30 more rolls of quarters in under a half hour). I also had some of the round 'pre-formed' rolls like they sell at Target (and are available on Amazon) and those worked like a charm without any fuss whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: RyeCat

customer_reviews.title: You don't need a fancy coin counting machine - these are terrific!!
customer_reviews.text: These things are awesome!! When I first got them I was a little skeptical as to how accurate they would be so I tested each one a couple times by counting the coins against the method you're supposed to use. Accurate on all tries! How easy - you can just sit and watch tv, talk to the family - whatever and roll away. You don't really have to pay much attention to the coins because you know the tubes will be accurate in their count. I would definitely buy again and recommend to a friend!
customer_reviews.author: Ida O

customer_reviews.title: Six dimes to many!!
customer_reviews.text: Waited over six weeks for delivery. Arrived today and couldn' t wait to try them. Quarter, nickle and penny tubes were accurate to the coin. The dime tube was off by six dimes. Tried again with same results. Rather than send them back I think that I'll go to the hardware store and buy some dime sized "O" rings and insert them into the tube to make up the six dime difference. If it works, I'll change my rating to 5 because I really think it's a good product that's fun to use.
customer_reviews.author: James K. Hosford Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. Coins fell into tubes perfectly, no coins not sitting flat. Counted a few 1 cent, 5 cent, 10 cent stacks to make sure they matched the slot in the tube as far as accuracy went and was pleased to note each 1 was a perfect match. Sliding the paper wrapper was fairly problem free. If the wrapper wouldn't slide down over the coins I simply inverted the tube and the coins slid into the wrapper. Couldn't be happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Bea

customer_reviews.title: GREAT, especially if you already have your coins separated.
customer_reviews.text: Been saving coins for years. Got really tired of manually counting and adding them to the wrappers. I started a few years ago separating the coins into individual containers when storing them. These worked perfectly when wrapping them. I didn't need any of the units that separated the coins. Also they are very reasonably priced.
customer_reviews.author: lsreeger

customer_reviews.title: No more counting by hand!
customer_reviews.text: Oh how I do not miss rolling coins by hand! Quick and convenient. This thing turned me into a rolling champion :) Able to roll hundreds of dollars in quarters in minutes. Accurately counts $10 in quarters. Have yet to use the other coin molds
customer_reviews.author: Julian J Bustamante

customer_reviews.title: just okay
customer_reviews.text: I like how these are color-coded to match the wrappers, but wish that they had the coin value written on the tube itself. Also, I wish that there was a vertical slot in the middle of the tube so you could see if you accidentally put the wrong coin in the tube. It gets the job done, but it could have a better design.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: OK
customer_reviews.text: Still have to count your coins ... cheap plastic ( do not leave in the sun) . If you need to wrap your coins ... this will help you "do the job" !
customer_reviews.author: MTW

customer_reviews.title: Time saver
customer_reviews.text: Saves me time and effort. You can slide the wrappers over coins if you start carefully. Only took me a few rolls to get goid at it.
customer_reviews.author: mpan

customer_reviews.title: Coin collector
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my husband. He loves going thru pennies to pull out the "Wheaties" and any coins he feels might be of value. He has a metal one which seems to be misplaced somewhere so I got him this set so he can re-roll the pennies (our bank doesn't have coin counters anymore). He said the metal one is much better as this has a tendency to get the coin sideways and slow him down. However, it does serve its purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy G.

customer_reviews.title: These are great!
customer_reviews.text: I had several mixed coins I needed to sort and roll. I didn’t want to pay a fortune for something to help me roll my coins and this seemed like the right product. I was pleasantly surprised at how well these worked. I was able to roll $300 of mixed coins in just a few hours. They work so easy.
customer_reviews.author: llemin

customer_reviews.title: Waste of time
customer_reviews.text: What?? Don't get why this is faster than counting and wrapping old school way. Didn't work for me. Found out my bank will take loose change, count it and deposit to my account at no charge. Before buying on of these things, suggest you check with your bank.
customer_reviews.author: Wawae nui

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this product. I have so many coin jars at home, I'm finally exchanging them for bills! I find this a lot better than those other machines that can get jammed up easily. This one is more tedious but it's a no brainer. I still count the coins I put in the tube but it's just for precaution. Other than that, it is pretty fun to use haha.
customer_reviews.author: Andi

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy design. Needs instructions.
customer_reviews.text: Works well. I was never exactly sure where the “full” mark was so I counted the coins realizing this is what I trying to avoid. Once you find the magic mark you are good to go.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen D. Guttery

customer_reviews.title: Works goid
customer_reviews.text: Works well, counted and wwrspoed $150 worth of coins in a few hours. $ 75 of which were pennies.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Once you master them, they are great.
customer_reviews.text: You have to master the trick to working with these. Start by reading the directions. Sorry guys, but that is a must. Make sure you place the wrappers at lest half way down and keep your finger on the stack of coins to prevent them from falling through. After a few times, you will whip through wrapping coins. Get the papers from MMF industries as the tubes are color coded to match the papers. Never thought wrapping coins could be so easy. Highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: JMF

customer_reviews.title: Works as described.
customer_reviews.text: Works perfect. Doesn't come labeled but, i just used a sharpie on them. I tend throw dimes in the nickels sometimes. They recommend the pre made rolls with one end already done. but, I have found no issue with the standard coin rolls I get from the bank, plus the banks it free.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: I haven't had an issue but those working with me routinely get a different count when using these.
customer_reviews.text: We are rolling $800 worth of coins....after years of collecting them. I don't seem to have a much trouble as some of the others in my party who are using these. They routinely get a different count making these unreliable. I've stuck with rolling only quarters and nickels so maybe the problem is with the thinner coins. Either way, those working with me won't use them.
customer_reviews.author: N. Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive time savers
customer_reviews.text: These are a pleasure to use. I used to roll coins the old way:counting and grouping into piles, then dropping coins into paper tubes. If you have a lot of coins to roll, do yourself a favor and get a set of these. The slot in the tube allows the excess coins to be shaken out the side, resulting in an exact count every time, so there is no counting of coins involved. Being made of plastic means they make less noise.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hutchin

customer_reviews.title: No gimmick, really works
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these with the coin sleeves, works perfect. Follow directions and will have no issues.
customer_reviews.author: DL in RVA

customer_reviews.title: Save time and get the job over with
customer_reviews.text: Oh, sure, I was mocked when I bought these. "We can count!" they said. Yeah, well, look who's stopped counting. Saving time is worth something too.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The price is a bit high for 4 pieces of ...
customer_reviews.text: The price is a bit high for 4 pieces of plastic but they do make life a lot easier. Some reviews complain that they should put the coins that each of the colored tubes should be for. This shouldnt be a problem as the paper rolls use the same color system, so all you need to do is match the color.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie

customer_reviews.title: Saves $$
customer_reviews.text: Simple easy and by far best invention. If you waist your $$ on an electronically driven change counter... Why are you saving change..? We use these while we're watching TV and it's so easy we roll over 200 in a flash.
customer_reviews.author: erin rosalind griffith

customer_reviews.title: Speeded up the counting and wrapping
customer_reviews.text: Tried four or 5 mechanical and automatic coin counters. As a coin collector, my needs are modest but still wrapping a 1000 pennies is tedious. These durable plastic devices speed up the process; just pour the pennies into the funnel; it cuts off at 50; and the wrapper is already prepositioned in the plastic tube ( wrappers are n/c at the local bank ) tap each end on the table and you are done. If you are going to count/wrap coins, this is easy.
customer_reviews.author: NaplesJack

customer_reviews.title: I love teaching my children how to roll their change or ...
customer_reviews.text: I love teaching my children how to roll their change or my change, really does not matter. These are perfect for change collectors or anyone who has a ton of change that they want to take to the bank.
customer_reviews.author: Melinda Haiden

customer_reviews.title: Quick and easy to use and accurate
customer_reviews.text: Had doubts about this it looks so simple. Wow it was great. We had over $800 in change. Did a roll of pennies in under 10 seconds wrapper slides in easily
customer_reviews.author: Eileen North

customer_reviews.title: Coin counting
customer_reviews.text: After my bank quit providing a coin counting machine, counting by hand was tiresome. I came across the counting tubes, got them and they work great!
customer_reviews.author: David Denniston

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: Simple to use and much better than an automated version.
customer_reviews.author: Hummingbird

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I would recommend this to anyone, easy to use and fun!
customer_reviews.author: Amy D

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product for newbies rolling their own coins
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product for newbies rolling their own coins. Nice heavy duty plastic tubes. Easy to see the line for accurate rolling. I rolled over $150 in about an 1 1/2 hours. I Would definitely recommend for any one who is willing to take a little extra time with coins. You can put many coins into the funnel at once without it jamming up. Super easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Lolo

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Perfect! Does exactly what its suppose to do and these are the best price.
customer_reviews.author: nicole

customer_reviews.title: These make measuring out coins easy, and putting coins in wrappers is easy also
customer_reviews.text: These make measuring out coins easy, and putting coins in wrappers is easy also. only one I had any problems with was dimes as they sometimes didn't want to stack easily.
customer_reviews.author: Albert Allen

customer_reviews.title: Sooooo EZ💰💰💰
customer_reviews.text: The coin counters work great making coin counting and wrapping a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: Sadie McGrade

customer_reviews.title: They are durable, easy to use and make wrapping coins faster.
customer_reviews.text: I only used the red only because i have a lot of pennies. It was easy to fill and the instructions were clear. The only problem was the accuracy but it has nothing to do with the tubes if the coins are either dirty or dent. The difference is only a penny. The plastic is strong and the delivery fast.
customer_reviews.author: Emma

customer_reviews.title: Useful
customer_reviews.text: It worked well for stacking the but I still had to count them and the tubes were hard to slide the papers into.
customer_reviews.author: Erica Hiemstra

customer_reviews.title: You need these!
customer_reviews.text: This and the color coded coin sorter are amazing! It was actually fun to sort and roll coins with my young son. Also recommend the already formed rolls, they slide right into these, then flip over, fold and your done.
customer_reviews.author: J. Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work.
customer_reviews.text: The penny sorter did not count to 50 but rather to 48. I did not check the other tubes and returned it to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: KMM

customer_reviews.title: This works pretty good I add all the coins first and the ...
customer_reviews.text: This works pretty good I add all the coins first and the right amount will fill up and tilt and the extra will slide out
customer_reviews.author: wonderer

customer_reviews.title: Good for new coins
customer_reviews.text: Use only the penny roll. It doesn't account for worn coins so constantly having to double check count. Maybe I'm being picky. Would work great with new pennies
customer_reviews.author: Michael M

customer_reviews.title: Time Saver!
customer_reviews.text: Makes coin wrapping a million times easier! I wrap thousands of dollars worth of quarters and I must say that this little tube is a life saver. Super quick and easy to use. Inexpensive and will save you tons of time. So glad I spent a few bucks on this little life saver. Very durable and I like that the denominations are color coded.
customer_reviews.author: ChristineX3

customer_reviews.title: Yes easy to do lots of change faster
customer_reviews.text: Yes easy to do lots of change faster. (I had acquired change from a departed loved one and did not want to stack out change as it would have taken much needed time in my busy schedule.) I found the wrappers I used were easy to insert for 3 of 4 tubes. The Dime tube was just a bit tricker to slide the wrapper into. Still a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: SteveB

customer_reviews.title: Speedy counting and works with flat, cheapo paper wrappers!
customer_reviews.text: Saved us the ~9% CoinStar charges and made for an interesting afternoon. I enjoyed the task and it worked great with the cheapo, flat paper wrappers. After putting the coins in the counter I worked the paper wrapper about 3/4" into the tube. Then, turn the tube upside down and shimmy the coins in.
customer_reviews.author: CJ Cincinnati

customer_reviews.title: GREAT FOR TEACHING KIDS TO SAVE
customer_reviews.text: My 9-year-old son rolled all of his coins and opened his first bank account. We used free paper roll sleeves from our local bank. Well made and accurate. Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: SKnight

customer_reviews.title: Fast and Fun
customer_reviews.text: Works great, good for pennies, accurate. works well with the free rolls from the bank. Quarters where a little difficult to get the roll on but the other coins were very easy I never could get the coins to slide in off the table (because of the tables beveled edge), but I held the tube in my left hand and fed the coins with my right, went through $300 of change quickly. I had been using coin star machines that charge 10%, so these tunes have already paid for themselves.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: Work great. Used to take me hours to sort, count and roll coins but with these it cuts the time by about 90%. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Larry M. Tedrow

customer_reviews.title: Alternative to Coin Counters!
customer_reviews.text: Since the banks have or are doing away with coin counting machines, this is the next best thing. I can watch TV and get the coins wrapped in no time.
customer_reviews.author: Savivi

customer_reviews.title: time saver
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and blasting through that Loose Change in a quickie
customer_reviews.author: rudy

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Works for what i need. Coins go into to the roll easy. Each size is a different color
customer_reviews.author: Nae Marie

customer_reviews.title: Simple to use, and no batteries
customer_reviews.text: These work as advertised. Simple to use. With any coin rolling setup, the only hard part is getting the coins to smoothly go into the paper rolls. Tried pouring coins into wrappers, pushing wrappers down over the coins in the tubes, and putting the wrappers in the tube before putting coins in. None were flawless, but then I haven't found a system yet that is...You end up figuring out a good technique and go with it.
customer_reviews.author: NMSUAggies

customer_reviews.title: It was very easy to use and the kids had a ball helping
customer_reviews.text: It was very easy to use and the kids had a ball helping. I counted and put into the sleeves about $200 worth of coins in about 15 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Independant

customer_reviews.title: ok product
customer_reviews.text: no marks on them to say how much but overall they work
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fast & Easy
customer_reviews.text: Buy pre-formed coin rolls and counting change is super fast and easy. Rolled $350 worth of different coins in 1/4 of the time. Money well spent
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Coin Ssorters
customer_reviews.text: Got tired of giving CoinStar 11% of my money so looked at many different types of sorters. These are as basic as you can get and so easy to use. Just a little practice and you are a pro. Worth every penny of the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Swede

customer_reviews.title: FUN!!
customer_reviews.text: These things are great!! A lot easier to use than doing it by hand. It takes a little patience to get the wrappers over the coins but if you tap tube they will go in. Now I wish I had more coins to count 1st because it would mean that I have more money, LOL and second because they're fun to use. Anyway GREAT product!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa St Romain

customer_reviews.title: No more counting coins!
customer_reviews.text: No more counting out coins! These gems really help save time in wrapping all that loose change and the "stem" helps for easy deposit of coins into paper wrapper. Quick, simple, no stress.
customer_reviews.author: S. Barrett

customer_reviews.title: Great for Kids!
customer_reviews.text: Great for kids! They loved sorting out their piggy bank money and rolling them up for deposit. Durable. Just missing labels in the parts themselves that designate which coin. It's listed in the box and easy enough to figure out but a label would be nice for th kiddos l.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. VSB

customer_reviews.title: I'm counting on you
customer_reviews.text: Very good as far as it goes, just wish it had increment marks too so I could get an exact count!
customer_reviews.author: Tibor O.

customer_reviews.title: Easy, fast, no batteries!
customer_reviews.text: These are great and so easy to use. I don't have to deal with machines that jam or need batteries. Really like that you can place the funnel at the edge of the table and just drop your coins in. Took a couple of tries to figure out how to put the paper wrapper around the coins but once I got the the hang of it, it was easy breezy!
customer_reviews.author: S Cayco

customer_reviews.title: Much easier then by hand
customer_reviews.text: So much easier then counting out the right amount of coins then packkng them into the roll. This you fill to the line and slide in a roll and tip all out with the paperthen close.
customer_reviews.author: DH

customer_reviews.title: Worth buying and keeping for years
customer_reviews.text: I love using this for my coin especially as a broke college student helps me keep track of my coins. When I’m ready I can stuff them in the paper wrappers that my bank requires us to use to make deposit.
customer_reviews.author: TheOneBuysTooMuch

customer_reviews.title: Bought a coin counter at a local store for $40 ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought a coin counter at a local store for $40 and returned it immediately -slow, inaccurate, and jammed. Ordered this after I was convinced by watching a video from a review on amazon of an elderly man using them with ease. Simple, practical, and does the job.
customer_reviews.author: MW

customer_reviews.title: Works fine for pre-sorted coins.
customer_reviews.text: Works fine to stack and sleeve coins. Need to give it a light shake when full to ensure the correct count of coins are stacked inside. This set only works for pre-sorted coins.
customer_reviews.author: Steve P.

customer_reviews.title: Beats counting coins...
customer_reviews.text: These are nice little gadgets for wrapping up your loose change. Makes the job a whole lot easier and faster. Wrapped up a 5 gallon jar of coins(after separation of course) in 2 and a half hours. Would have not been able to do that without these coin counting tubes. Delivered on time as promised and worked well. Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Toddsshare

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: These tubes came on time and work exactly as advertised even down to the point that they are more precise than the U S Mints production of pennies. The good news is I turn the rolled coins into my bank and if I am over or under a penny they make the correction. I know, the banks rob us of Billions of dollars in the housing bust and I still trust them with my pennies, I am a slow learner.
customer_reviews.author: fuzzyjoe

customer_reviews.title: Easy to sue
customer_reviews.text: I own a concession type business and often have a lot of change to count. I was tempted to purchase an electronic counter/roller, however after reading the reviews of change being miscounted and/or put into the wrong cases, I dediced to get these. It would be helpful if it was clearer on when you reached 50 coins. There are small slots cut into the plasic near the top, however that space is about 1/2" thick and you could easily fill up each roll with a different count of coins.
customer_reviews.author: alia al-hagri

customer_reviews.title: These work as advertised and are accurate. Makes cashing ...
customer_reviews.text: These work as advertised and are accurate. Makes cashing out faster. Now if somebody could just make a color tinted polycarbonate one with markings on it.
customer_reviews.author: John from LA

customer_reviews.title: These coin tubes really work well and nothing gets broken or worn down ...
customer_reviews.text: These really work! If any "jam" occurs, it is very easily dealt with and nothing gets broken or worn down - unlike what can happen with powered devices. I'm glad we tried this setup before we ventured into various powered setups that are available...
customer_reviews.author: Dave Kruschke

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Saved me hours on my 5 gallon jug of change!
customer_reviews.author: Lil-G

customer_reviews.title: They Work Great. Love That Old Dude In The Video
customer_reviews.text: That's definitely gonna be me - sitting at home with nothing else to do but wrap my coins, one day...
customer_reviews.author: gregory webster

customer_reviews.title: Not working for us
customer_reviews.text: They didn't work properly for us. Either we did something wrong or they don't count coins consistently correctly.
customer_reviews.author: Mel Wolfson

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive, work great, will last a long time
customer_reviews.text: They're inexpensive, work great, and seem like they'll last forever.
customer_reviews.author: John Emm

customer_reviews.title: Saves Time ... Time Is Money!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my apartment manager. Every week she sat there counting quarters, from the laundry, and stuffing them into sleves. Since using these, she has much more time to do more important things. She loves 'um!
customer_reviews.author: Senior Seeker

customer_reviews.title: I'm impressed.
customer_reviews.text: My bank gave me a bunch of paper rolls and I counted out my coins and stuffed the roll by hand. I figured there must be a better way. I read that you can use the bank paper rolls with these. I just did! I'm impressed.
customer_reviews.author: McNystrom

customer_reviews.title: Work as it should. For a piece of plastic, it could be cheaper, but oh well.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to do, and works with the wraps you can get at a bank for free. Just tilt the coin tube side-ways and shake to get it to slide around the coins. Works nicely and is easy to do once you get a hang of it.
customer_reviews.author: MickeyD

customer_reviews.title: Quick way to roll coins
customer_reviews.text: Great set just one small complaint....it can be hard to tell when the last coin should come out to complete the roll or if you have an extra. But once you know it you are fine. It also takes a bit to get the roll in but once you masters it the things G's show their true value.
customer_reviews.author: David Cartagena

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Saves a bunch of time. I wish I had it sooner
customer_reviews.author: Frederick Kelley

product_meta.title: PM Company Color-Coded Coin Counting Tube for Pennies Through Quarters (05032)
product_meta.description: Size:Set of 4PM Company # 05032 - Coin Counting Tubes - Makes rolling coins so much easier. One tube for each penny, nickels, dimes and quarters (Coin wrappers sold separately).
feature_bullets: Four color-coded tubes (ABA colors) for pennies through quarters. (Coin wrappers sold separately.).
Insert wrapper, invert and coins are counted and wrapped in one exact roll.
Simply drop coins into tube until excess spills from slot.
Color-coded coin tubes (ABA - Federal Reserve Colors to match wrappers)
Simply drop coins into tube until excess spills from slot. Insert wrapper, invert and coins are counted and wrapped in one exact roll.
Four color-coded tubes (red, blue, green and orange) for pennies through quarters. (Coin wrappers sold separately.).

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars625 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
